intro: Hieracium floribundiforme, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium floribundiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
